Eligibility for VA Health Care

If you served in combat operations after November 11, 1998, you may be eligible for enhanced eligibility for up to 5 years after discharge or release for any condition related to your service in Operation Enduring Freedom (OEF), Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF), or Operation New Dawn (OND) in Iraq. To apply, you must meet certain requirements, including serving in a theater of combat operations after November 11, 1998, and being discharged or released from active service on or after January 29, 2003. If you qualify, you will be enrolled in priority group 6, unless you qualify for a higher priority group based on your income or a service-connected disability. You will receive free care and medications for any condition that may be related to your combat service, but you may need to pay copays for care and medications that are clearly not related to your military service. You will stay enrolled in VA health care even after your enhanced eligibility period ends, and you may be eligible for one-time dental care for any needed conditions. To apply, you must submit your application within 180 days of discharge or separation.

To apply, you must have served at least 24 continuous months or the full period for which you were called to active duty, unless any of the following descriptions are true for you:

* You were discharged for a disability that was caused or made worse by your active-duty service.
* You were discharged for a hardship or early out.
* You served prior to September 7, 1980.

If you are a current or former member of the Reserves or National Guard, you must have been called to active duty by a federal order and completed the full period for which you were called or ordered to active duty. If you had or have active-duty status for training purposes only, you don't qualify for VA health care.

If you have received a dishonorable, bad conduct, or dishonorable discharge, you may not be eligible for VA benefits. However, there are two ways you can try to qualify:

* Find out how to apply for a discharge upgrade.

* Receiving financial compensation payments from VA for a service-connected disability.
